raw_text:
Swiss cement firm in buying spree
 
 Swiss cement firm Holcim has bid $800m (£429m) to buy two Indian cement firms and a holding company in the country.
 
 It plans to buy Associated Cement Companies (ACC), Ambuja Cement Eastern and the holding firm, Ambuja Cement India Ltd, a Holcim statement said. Shares in ACC fell 5.5% as investors, who thought the offer was underpriced, decided to sell. Meanwhile, UK-based firm Aggregate Industries said it had agreed a £1.8bn takeover by Holcim.
 
 The deal with Aggregates will give Holcim, the world's second-biggest cement maker, an entry into the UK market and boost its presence in the US. Peter Tom, who will remain as Aggregate chief executive, said the 138p a share offer provided "significant value" for shareholders. The Markfield, Leicestershire-based company runs 142 quarries in the UK and the US. It also has 164 ready-mixed concrete plants, 90 asphalt plants and 32 pre-cast concrete factories.
 
 If the Indian deals go ahead, it will give Holcim a major presence in the world's fastest-growing market behind China. ACC is India's second-largest cement maker with an annual capacity of 18.2 million tonnes and a market share of 13%. "Holcim is looking to buy it (ACC) very cheap," said KK Mittal, a fund manager with Escorts Mutual Fund in New Delhi. "The market is not impressed. If they want a substantial chunk, then they should be paying a premium over the market price." Shares in Holcim rose by 2.3% on Thursday following news of the takeover.
llama3.2:1b: Swiss cement firm Holcim has agreed to buy two Indian cement firms and a holding company for £429m. The deal will give Holcim an entry into the UK market, boosting its presence in the US, and provide significant value to shareholders, with shares rising 2.3% after the news.
llama3.2:3b: Holcim to buy two Indian cement firms and a holding company for $800m, including Associated Cement Companies (ACC) and Aggregate Industries for £1.8bn, with plans to enter India's market and boost US presence.
gemma2:2b: Holcim, a Swiss cement firm, has agreed to buy two Indian cement firms (ACC and Ambuja Cement Eastern) as well as the holding company Ambuja Cement India Ltd for $800 million.  The move will give Holcim a substantial presence in India's rapidly growing market and also boost its presence in the US and UK.  Shares in ACC fell after investors perceived the offer to be too low, while Aggregate Industries agreed to be acquired by Holcim for £1.8 billion.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Swiss cement firm Holcim has announced two major acquisitions: the acquisition of Associated Cement Companies (ACC) for £800m and an agreement with Aggregate Industries to buy their 138p share offer for £1.8bn. This will give Holcim a significant presence in the UK market and increase its presence in the US, as well as boost its overall cement making.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Swiss cement firm Holcim buys two Indian cement firms and an Indian holding company for $800 million, giving it access to UK and US markets and entering China's fastest-growing market behind India. Holcim offers £1.8 billion to Aggregate Industries shareholders in return for 138p per share.
qwen2.5:3b: Swiss cement firm Holcim has bid $800m to acquire two Indian cement firms and a holding company, valuing ACC at £429m. ACC's share price fell after investors deemed the offer underpriced. Holcim also agreed to buy UK-based Aggregate Industries for £1.8bn, expanding its presence in both countries. The deal with Aggregate will give Holcim an entry into the US market and strengthen its position there. If successful, the Indian acquisitions will allow Holcim to enter India's fast-growing cement market behind China, despite criticism of the bid price. Holcim's share value rose on news of these deals.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, I need to summarize this text about Holcim buying two cement companies and another holding. The user wants only the summary without any explanations or formatting.

First, the main event is Holcim bidding for ACC and Ambuja Cement Eastern. ACC shares fell because investors thought the bid was underpriced. They sold some shares after seeing the deal done.

Then there's the UK takeover by Aggregate Industries for £1.8bn. This helps Holcim enter the UK market and boost their presence in the US, where they have a strong presence in 142 quarries and various facilities.

The summary should include the key points: Holcim's acquisition of ACC and others, the UK acquisition deal with Aggregate Industries, the size of each company, and how this affects Holcim's global market position. I need to make sure all important details are covered succinctly.
</think>

Swiss cement giant Holcim is buying two Indian cement firms and a holding company, as per its statement. The bid for ACC (Indonesia Cement) fell by 5.5%, with investors selling some shares after the deal closed. Also, Aggregate Industries (UK) agreed to buy £1.8bn worth of Holcim stock, which could boost the global market share and presence. Holcim, second in the cement industry globally, now has a major presence in India's fastest-growing market and expanded operations in the US, with 142 quarries, 164 ready-mixed plants, and 90 asphalt plants in total.
tinyllama:1.1b: Swiss cement firm Holcim has acquired two Indian cement firms and a holding company, with a total consideration of $800 million (£429 million). The deal is part of Holcim's plans to expand in the fast-growing Indian market and enter the UK market. Agreegates, which already holds a 51% stake in Holcim, has agreed a £1.8 billion takeover offer for the company. The deal also includes the American subsidiary of Holcim and shares in the Ambujapetrofacentral Limited (AMPI) joint venture between Holcim and AMPI, formerly known as Ambuja Cements. If the Indian deals go ahead, Holcim will become the second-largest cement maker globally behind China, with a total market share of 13%. The acquisitions are part of a wider strategy to expand in the fast-growing Indian market and enter the UK market. As a result of the deal, Holcim has gained access to an additional $240 million in capital from Agreegates, who will remain as CEO.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
Swiss cement firm Holcim has entered into an acquisition spree with two Indian cement companies, and a holding company for their respective groups. 

The company plans to buy ACC, Ambuja Cement Eastern (ACE), and the holding company, Ambuja Cement India Ltd, at a total value of $800 million. This acquisition is expected to bolster Holcim's presence in India and will give it access to a substantial market share.

Aggregate Industries has agreed to a £1.8 billion takeover offer for Holcim. The deal would give the Swiss firm an entry into the UK market, boosting its presence in the US and enhancing its overall reach in both markets. 

Shares in Aggregate Industries increased by 3% following news of the takeover offer. However, Peter Tom, who will remain as the company's CEO after the acquisition, stated that the offer provided significant value for shareholders and would benefit both companies.

The deal will give them an entry into the UK market and boost their presence in the US. If the Indian deals go ahead, it will give Holcim a major presence in the world's fastest-growing market behind China. ACC is India'S second-largest cement maker with an annual capacity of 18.2 million tonnes and a market share of 13%. Shares in AGgereate Industries rose by 2.3% after news of the deal. The market is not impressed and sees the offer as underpriced.
orca-mini:3b: Swiss cement firm Holcim has bid $800 million for two Indian cement firms and a holding company in the country, as it seeks to expand its presence in the world's fastest-growing market behind China. If the deals go ahead, it will give Holcim a major presence in India.
hermes3:3b: Holcim buys Indian cement firms ($800m) and UK-based Aggregate Industries for $429m (£1.8b). This increases Holcim's presence in fast-growing Indian market and entry into UK market, boosting its global presence as second-biggest cement maker.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: A big Swiss cement company called Holcim has offered to buy two Indian cement companies and a holding company for $800 million. This will help Holcim, which makes cement, become number two in the world. They also want to join the UK market and do better in the United States. If the deals happen in India, this will be a big part of the growing market behind China. People are not very happy with the price Holcim is offering for one company, but they still made their shares go up after hearing about the deal.

Investors deemed the offer underpriced, leading to a 5.5% drop in ACC shares. Additionally, UK-based Aggregate Industries agreed to a £1.8 billion takeover by Holcim, granting it entry into the UK market and strengthening its US presence. Aggregate operates 142 quarries, 164 concrete plants, 90 asphalt plants, and 32 pre-cast concrete factories. If the Indian acquisitions proceed, Holcim will gain a strong foothold in India's fast-growing cement market. ACC, India's second-largest cement maker, has an 18.2 million-tonne annual capacity and a 13% market share. Some investors believe Holcim's offer undervalues ACC. Holcim shares rose 2.3% following the takeover news.
stablelm2:1.6b: Swiss cement firm Holcim has bid $X for Indian cement firms ACC and Ambuja Cement as well as a holding company, increasing its presence in the US and UK markets. If the deals proceed, Holcim will have a major foothold in India's rapidly growing market after China. Shares in Holcim rose 2.3% after news of the takeover.
granite3.1-dense:2b:
Swiss cement giant Holcim has announced plans to acquire two Indian firms, Associated Cement Companies (ACC), Ambuja Cement Eastern, and a holding company, Ambuja Cement India Ltd, for $800m (£429m). This move will grant Holcim entry into India's rapidly growing cement market, making it the second-largest cement producer globally. Shares in ACC fell 5.5% due to underpriced expectations.

Additionally, UK-based Aggregate Industries agreed to a £1.8bn takeover by Holcim, providing significant value for shareholders and bolstering Holcim's presence in the US. Aggregate Industries operates 142 quarries, 90 asphalt plants, and 32 pre-cast concrete factories across the UK and US.

Following these acquisitions, Holcim anticipates a substantial presence in India, where ACC holds the second position with an annual capacity of 18.2 million tonnes and a 13% market share. KK Mittal, a fund manager from Escorts Mutual Fund in New Delhi, noted that Holcim should pay a premium over the market price to secure such a substantial stake.

Holcim's shares increased by 2.3% on the day of the announcements.
reference: The deal with Aggregates will give Holcim, the world's second-biggest cement maker, an entry into the UK market and boost its presence in the US.Swiss cement firm Holcim has bid $800m (£429m) to buy two Indian cement firms and a holding company in the country.It plans to buy Associated Cement Companies (ACC), Ambuja Cement Eastern and the holding firm, Ambuja Cement India Ltd, a Holcim statement said.ACC is India's second-largest cement maker with an annual capacity of 18.2 million tonnes and a market share of 13%.If the Indian deals go ahead, it will give Holcim a major presence in the world's fastest-growing market behind China.Meanwhile, UK-based firm Aggregate Industries said it had agreed a £1.8bn takeover by Holcim.
